result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovonie S Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Not called on the record.  9:43 AM Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jovonie S Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Menden requests more time in this matter. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:39 AM Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jovonie S Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Menden requests a further status date and states reason on the record.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 2:11 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court with attorney Eryn M Menden. 
Attorney Menden requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense indicates offer is contingent on treatment.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:39 AM Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Hearing on April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

he Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to time limits for a prelim hearing.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
THE COURT WILL SCHEDULE A STATUS OF COUNSEL DATE WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT SHOULD AN ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL BE FILED THAT DATE WILL COME OFF.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

08:39 AM Defendant Jovonie S Rivera in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
